definition:
A normed space is *uniformly convex* iff $\forall \epsilon>0$ there
exists $\delta>0$ that satisfies for $\|x\|\leq1$ $\|y\|\leq1$ and
$\|x-y\|> \epsilon$ $\Rightarrow$ $\|\frac{x+y}{2}\|\leq1$-$\delta$.\
\
For example it is easily seen that the normed space
$(\mathbb{R}^2,\|.\|_{2})$ is uniformly convex space. Also $L^p$ and
$l^p$ spaces for $1<p<\infty$ are uniformly convex, see *[ J.A.
Clarkson, “Uniformly convex spaces”, Trans. Amer. Math. Society, 40
(1936), 396-414.]{}*
